text: Thallium(I) iodide, also known as thallous iodide, is a chemical compound. Its chemical formula is TlI. It has thallium and iodide ions in it. The thallium is in its +1 oxidation state. ==Properties== Thallium(I) iodide is a yellow solid. It does not dissolve in water. It turns red when heated gently. It is a reducing agent. It is very toxic like all thallium compounds. ==Preparation== It is made by reacting thallium with iodine or hydroiodic acid or by reacting any soluble thallium salt like thallium(I) sulfate with any iodide. ==Uses== Thallium(I) iodide is used in mercury-vapor lamps. It is also used in a detector of radiation. ==Related pages== *Thallium(III) oxide *Thallium(I) bromide *Thallium(I) chloride Category:Thallium compounds Category:Iodine compounds
